comments.body:
I think resin light sources should be extra bright compared to other light sources.

Also I tried suggesting this same thing but it kept getting deleted...

Why doesn't it work better as glue? Use the resin to "glue" the crystals to make the edges transparent without external texture packs

Or also to use it as a paint base to tint chests, item frames...

I don't think that a wizard boss fit the theme of Minecraft right now, but perhaps there is a new type of villager trapped in the tower that you should try and free from the pale garden? The tower could have a range of redstone traps and such, including a new observer-like block made with the creaking heart. This new redstone block will send out a signal when a mob enters the block after the block infront of it (it can see through one block). Obviously this new block would be really useful in redstone traps and such, but because you cant farm creaking hearts there is a finite amount, the new villager would sell these new observer-like blocks though as their final trade.
I think we should name it something else and make it used for making wood types fireproof instead. having a new use is better than making it have the same use as an existing thing.
Yes, please!
And naming them this way should stop them from de-spawning during the day.

I think this is a great idea, although I think that is should have a cool down on the respawn rate as if you go to the trouble of digging it a hole while being attacked by other hostile mobs only to have it respawn a second later seems a little unfair.

This a unique idea. Can you explain more about its behavior when it moves along walls and in water?

Quick suggestion: I think the blossom should contain a pollen that can be used to create a potion when added into a water bottle. This would present several question of blossom types or of potion chances.
it's behavior along walls would probably be slimy, it could display a simple partical effect, or even to the extreme place a slime trail, which could be a recoloured carpet or redstone dust.

I agree that the blossom should have harvestable pollen, but I think crafting the potion should require a brewing stand. I think a single type of blossom and potion is enough.

For another point, the snail should be attracted to a player holding moss or pink petals so that it could be lured back to the player's base.
Add Piranhas!!!! White ones, that eat you alive!!!! With really, really BIG teeth!
Uh... no, please.
Actually, that sounds good at first, but it's too easy to manipulate and get the achievement

idk about the zombies part. zombies are just so goofy and iconic i could never associate them with anything creepy. i would say that drinking the potion unleashes orange colored ghosts and haunting spirits to hunt you down or smth like that.

The resin caves will be like this: 

 

  • There can also be mineshafts made out of pale oak wood generated in the resin caves: https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/30767883164429-Pale-Mineshaft
  • Gold, copper and redstone ores generate very commonly in this cave biome in larger blobs. Tuff blobs can also generate at surface level.
  • Cobwebs may generate frequently in this biome.
  • The only other mobs that spawns in this biome aside from creakings are skeletons, spiders and cave spiders.
  • Pumpkins can also generate in this biome.
yes finale one person he throught that
comunity vote in this post
What would you call resin?
OOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOH
maybe sap? sap is found in the wood though. not the bark.

I already heard people saying "just burn it down" making the biome fireproof will be a good feature and it also makes sense, the wood is naturaly so full of resin that it can't burn, that's also why it can be harvested from these trees. I love this idea
We've needed a way to skip to sunset for a long time.
"You may not rest now. You have to enjoy the fun of the night."

Hmmm... how would this work in multiplayer. If you were in the pale garden and slept until sunset like you propose, and you had a friend in a nearby normal biome, how would that work? Would they skip to sunset as well, even though they weren't actually sleeping in a bed? I like the idea, but I think it needs a little bit of tinkering to be usable. Great idea beside that though!

An answer to previous questions: (from the person who made this post)

In multiplayer I think it would work the same as normal sleeping, it only works if everyone is doing it. If someone wants to sleep in the pale garden during day (thus skipping to night) then it only works if everyone else is sleeping IN THE PALE GARDENS. 

Normal sleeping only works if everyone is in a bed and it's night time. This sleeping only works if its day time, everyone is in the pale gardens, and everyone is in bed.

In case anyone misunderstood, players in the pale gardens CANNOT sleep in a bed during nighttime, they must walk out of the biome if they want to skip to morning, meaning the game never has to choose between two players, one sleeping in the pale gardens, and another sleeping out of the pale gardens. If its day time and players are in the pale gardens than they can sleep in a bed.

Basically this is no different than the normal multiplayer bed rules.

Thats how I would make it work anyway, thanks for the question :)
Ah okay that makes a lot more sense. Thanks for clarifying! ðŸ¤—

Hi! I had the same idea, but making it a little harder to achieve.
Option 1: Not guaranteed to skipâ€¦ more like a random chance to skip the day.
Option 2: A potion made from the pale flowers to allow user to sleep through the day.
Youâ€™ve got my vote!
the point of the garden is to stay there till night, not get out faster.
adding to that other guy's comment i think it should only be harvestable at night.

This would be great! You could make coconut water and you could make coconut milk which would do the same thing as milk, but there should be some difference between milk and coconut milk. You could craft them by putting a coconut in a crafting table anywhere and it would become coconut water then you could make coconut milk by making a bucket shape with coconut water and it would make coconut milk.
Is it in new snapshot?

Sounds great! Any new lighting option is a welcome addition to Minecraft, and this would allow for more control over builds.

 

I'd also like to tag on a variant that decreases the light level so some interesting shadow patterns could be created.

Great idea! But I think that the Creaking should have a much higher chance to spawn invisible than a spider, otherwise the chances are so low there's no use bothering to worry over being stalked by an invisible monster in a creepy forest....
Yes that's good, the chances should be much higher than that of a spider.
Oh, and I voted, by the way. I definitely hope this gets implemented.
I think this is a cool idea, but it might seem a little creepier if the leaves are gray instead of white. the white just makes you think of a wedding.

Gray leaves would better fit the atmospere , thats true.
But I would take eather one, white or gray :D

The biome would look less static with the falling leaves.

To answer the comment saying 'what's wrong with that??' the Pale Garden is supposed to be a creepy, mysterious place, to make you a little nervous. A wedding just doesn't fit in with the atmosphere of the biome.
You have my vote!
How about calcite (for cave blocks)? Calcite have no use, I want calcite blocks.
More pale garden variants in general, make it seem like the mutation/corruption is not only affecting one specific biome. Cool idea.
And the willow trees would play amazingly together with the swapy area.
I think this should be implimented with hollow stripped log stairs.
This is a really cool idea, nice little addition that can give people access to wood types that might not be near them in the early game.
Great idea! And the black and white vision lasts for around 20 seconds or something under a minute.

Or what if stepping on pale moss blocks only so it can work with other biomes?

also your bringing the supersecret settings back...

you didn't happen to post that pale spider boss post, did you?

(in response to previous comment)
i like your idea, just stop spamming the feedback site
if i told you, you would easily find a way around it.
What's everyone's deal with pale oak being a "rip off" of dark oak? Birch is a "rip off" of regular oak by that logic.

Yeah we don't need another oak tree we already have oak and dark oak.
Willow would be 100x better because like you said it was literally inspired from willow trees.
I didn't know that but ok. Typo found.
maybe dark oak trees could be converted into pale oak ones every new moon if there close enough, or if there arent any dark oak trees in the vicinity new saplings could be formed.
I love the pale garden idea! But the creaking doesn't do enough damage!
I like this.

This is a great idea and will put the player on edge when wandering through the biome. (If you're there at night and were silly enough not to bring a bed because let's face it, there is no incentive to be in the biome at night and face the creaking.) This idea will better if they were an exact copy of the creaking eyes as when the player would finally come across one, they wouldn't be sure if it was a tree or not. This would also add to the tree like feel of the creaking. This idea would also would be better if the creaking spawning sound wasn't as noticeable as it currently is, so you wouldn't know if the creaking had spawned or not. Decoy spawning sounds at night maybe? And finally it's a must to have the decoy creaking eyes move and blink, it should not be static!
